threats.Source: Internal or External Client Using Stale Secrets
threats.Description: Secrets not configured for rotation can become stale, increasing the risk of unauthorized disclosure or misuse.
threats.Mitigation: Enable rotation in Secrets Manager and configure rotation intervals to meet compliance requirements.

threats.Source: Misconfigured Rotation Process or Missing Rotation Lambda
threats.Description: If a scheduled rotation fails (e.g., due to rotation function errors), secrets remain unrotated and vulnerable.
threats.Mitigation: Monitor scheduled rotation status, ensure rotation Lambda is properly configured and has required permissions.

threats.Source: Credentials Allowed to Age Too Long
threats.Description: Secrets exceeding the maximum recommended days since rotation can lead to unauthorized use of outdated credentials.
threats.Mitigation: Set a maximum age for secrets in Secrets Manager and enforce regular rotation intervals (e.g., 90 days).

threats.Description: Secrets unused for a prolonged period may indicate orphaned credentials, increasing exposure if leaked.
threats.Mitigation: Regularly audit secrets for usage, remove or rotate unused secrets to minimize attack surface.

threats.Source: Unauthorized Parties with Access to AWS-managed Encryption
threats.Description: Secrets not encrypted using a customer-managed KMS key (CMK) reduce the control over encryption and key rotation.
threats.Mitigation: Configure secrets to use CMK for encryption, granting fine-grained control over key policies and rotations.
